hints.content: Start by removing all dashes from the string. This will simplify the process of formatting the license key. You can use a method like `replace` to achieve this.
After removing dashes, convert all lowercase letters to uppercase. This is important as the final output must be in uppercase. Consider using a method like `upper()`.
Next, determine the length of the cleaned string. This will help you figure out how to split it into groups of size `k`.
The first group can be shorter than `k`, but it must contain at least one character. Calculate how many characters will go into the first group.
To find the number of characters in the first group, you can use the modulo operation. Specifically, calculate `length % k` to find out how many characters will be in the first group.
Once you know the size of the first group, you can start forming the groups. Use a loop to create groups of size `k` from the remaining characters after the first group.
Remember to insert dashes between the groups. You can use a list to collect the groups and then join them with dashes at the end.
Be careful with edge cases, such as when the input string has no dashes or when all characters are already uppercase. Make sure your solution handles these smoothly.
When constructing the final string, ensure that there are no leading or trailing dashes. The dashes should only appear between groups.
Finally, put all the pieces together: remove dashes, convert to uppercase, split into groups, and join with dashes. Make sure to return the formatted string as the output.

questionNotes: The input string s consists of alphanumeric characters and dashes.
The first group can be shorter than k but must have at least one character.
All lowercase letters must be converted to uppercase.
Return the reformatted license key with dashes between groups.
